snippet: Advocacy groups said that school districts were violating the students’ civil rights and that the students, some as young as 12, were prosecuted as adults.
abstract: Advocacy groups file civil rights complaint with Justice Department on behalf of seven students in Texas, some as young as 12, who were prosecuted as adults in truancy courts in Dallas County.
lead_paragraph: Advocacy groups said that school districts were violating the students’ civil rights and that the students, some as young as 12, were prosecuted as adults.

headline.seo: Complaint Filed With Justice Dept. in Texas Truancy Cases
